blog.name: ao3feed-jonrya
blog.title: AO3feed-Jonrya
blog.description: An automated feed for Jon x Arya fics posted on AO3.

title: Arya (may change later)
description:
by Currer_Bell

Four years ago, you could have asked anyone in the Winter Kingdoms about whether or not prince Jon was capable of causing a scandal, and the answer would have been negative. He was a polite, well-mannered boy at the age of fourteen; Arya remembered him smiling shyly whenever he was complimented, remembered his sharp gasp as he first gazed upon the lovely face of his intended, remembered how he used to muss her hair.

She remembered the day everything had suddenly changed. She’d been too young to know what had happened; in fact, nobody knew the exact events that had led Jon to leave Winterfell in the middle of a winter’s night four years ago.

“He’s left,” father had said.

Words: 347, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms, Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings, Underage
  • Categories: F/M, Gen
  • Characters: Arya Stark, Wylla Manderly, Sansa Stark, Jon Snow, Robb Stark, Bran Stark, Ned Stark, Original House Stark Character(s), Original House Forrester Character(s), Direwolf | Direwolves, Wendel Manderly, Robin Flint, Galbart Glover, Robett Glover, Wyman Manderly, Mors “Crowfood” Umber, Hother “Whoresbane” Umber, Jon “The Greatjon” Umber, Jon “The Smalljon” Umber, Barbrey Dustin, Catelyn Tully Stark, but she’s not a Tully, that wouldn’t make sense
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Arya Stark
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe, Independent North, The King in The North, Queen in the North, Implied/Referenced Suicide, Arranged Marriage

summary:
I mean I don't attribute anything else to Jon and his statue looking older than D&D wanting to make him look more regal -
But I...
body:
I mean I don’t attribute anything else to Jon and his statue looking older than D&D wanting to make him look more regal -

But I am flabbergasted that while everyone is speculating that it means that he lives and the girls die -

NO ONE has ever put forward the idea that it means that JON IS AGING FASTER due to his resurrection experience.

There have been ideas before this teaser that Jon’s life expectancy will be shortened by his resurrection. What if it’s what it looks like?

tags: source is from mamma mia 2 for those wondering
summary:
(my prediction for game of thrones season 8)
Arya: Gendry, did you tell everybody that we're engaged?
Gendry: No, I didn't tell...
body:
(my prediction for game of thrones season 8)

Arya: Gendry, did you tell everybody that we’re engaged?

Gendry: No, I didn’t tell anyone. Did you?

Arya: I only told Sansa because she’s my sister.

Sansa: And I only told Bran because he would have figured it out anyway.

Bran: I only told Jon because he’s part of the family

Jon: I told many, many people.

blog.name: tumblrofthrones
blog.title: Tumblr of Thrones
blog.description:
*SPOILER POLICY*

While I've read all the ASOIAF books, I don't reblog or post spoilers beyond the current episode, episode preview or trailer. I'm in the eastern US time zone (EDT/EST), so please take that under advisement for spoiler purposes on show nights. Thanks!

blog.name: gendrie
blog.title: fierce and terrible and hers
blog.description:
annalesa / 27 / pisces /
they would not make her yield

title: asoiaf + as you like it
body:
there’s many similarities between asoiaf and shakespeare. as you like it is no exception. both contain themes of nature vs society (specifically “court”) and heavily feature songs. but its with three characters in particular - arya, ned and gendry - that i see the most similarities

Here shall he see no enemy
But winter and rough weather. 

duke senior is like ned stark if he had gotten lucky. the former is banished to the woods after a political coup which he’s actually pretty happy about because court is full of “peril” and “envy”. ned reflects that same attitude:

Eddard Stark wanted nothing so much as to return to Winterfell, to the clean simplicity of the north, where the enemies were winter and the wildlings beyond the Wall. (AGOT)

i find that to be a very compelling parallel. those quotes are exactly the same. they hate the court of liars and crave the wild. its dangerous, cold and brutal in its own way but honest. the north in asoiaf is considered one great wilderness since it does not have a traditional court. but while duke senior is eventually reinstated ned stark is executed. both their daughters are caught in the middle of this.

I do remember in this shepherd boy
Some lively touches of my daughter’s favor.

arya is forced to flee to the wilds disguised as a boy called arry (like rosalind who assumes the alias ganymede) as a result of her father’s involvement in these political instabilities. arya and rosalind are both clever, bold, loyal and resourceful. but arya’s relationship with gender is far more complicated than rosalind who does not “have a doublet and hose in [her] disposition” the play really reinforces gender roles in the end where as asoiaf is far more critical and allows for more complexity. but they do have another huge parallel and that is they form close bonds to the sons of the father’s friends

ARYA: Maybe King Robert had drunk a lot, but he’d been her father’s friend. 

ROSALIND: The duke my father loved his father dearly.

and its pretty obvious in both cases who their fathers are

If that you were the good Sir Rowland’s son, As you have whispered faithfully you were,
And as mine eye doth his effigies witness
Most truly limned and living in your face, Be truly welcome hither. I am the duke
That loved your father. 

when duke senior meets orlando he quickly realizes he is his father’s son. ned had the same reaction to gendry:

That the armorer’s sullen apprentice was the king’s son, Ned had no doubt. The Baratheon look was stamped on his face, in his jaw, his eyes, that black hair. […] Gendry had to be Robert’s. (AGOT)

orlando and gendry have notable strength and are stubborn too. arya/gendry and orlando/rosalind must flee from court/the city or lose their lives and its in the forest where their relationships grow. in the forest, in disguise, they are able to form a bond that is seldom seen between men and women within the confines of court: friendship. they are equals in this environment. theres no rules so its a place of freedom and discovery. that goes doubly so for arya and gendry since unlike orlando he is of a much lower birth than arya

Sir you have wrestled well, and overthrown
more than your enemies.

both pairs also have significant wrestling scenes that are very symbolic. rosalind and orlando first meet after he successfully wrestles an opponent and both compare their instant feelings for each other to being “overthrown” the act of falling in love is compared to a wrestling match

Arya shoved him back against the anvil and made to run, but Gendry caught her arm. She stuck a foot between his legs and tripped him, but he yanked her down with him, and they rolled across the floor of the smithy. 

arya and gendry take it one step further by actually wrestling with each other. which would be considered highly inappropriate. arya is a princess and gendry is a blacksmith. but they don’t care. this scene is all romantic subtext. arya and gendry are just children now - this is playful - but the implications is that when they’re grown they’ll be wrestling in a less innocent way. its directly followed by a love song about a man and a woman who want to be together. he wants to lay her down in a featherbed but shes content to roll around in the grass. 

It was a lover and his lass,
That o’er the green cornfield did pass

But you can be my forest love,
and me your forest lass. (ASOS)

as you like it has more songs than any other shakespeare play (or so i read) asoiaf also features many songs. arya and gendry have their own love theme that revolves around the same major theme in this play which is the contrast between the conventions of society and the freedom nature provides. 

All the world’s a stage,
And all the men and women merely players;
They have their exits and their entrances,
And one man in his time plays many parts 

this is probably the plays most famous passage. i find it extremely applicable to arya who assumes numerous personas/aliases throughout her story - even becoming an actress in a very shakespearen like play. the theater is a hugely important element in her mercy chapter. the rest of this speech describes how lives are broken in “seven ages” from infant to lover to solider ect. which reminded me of the faith of the seven in asoiaf that breaks a single entity into several aspects that represent an individual’s layered humanity. 

I could find in my heart to disgrace my man’s apparel and to cry like a woman; but I must comfort
the weaker vessel, as doublet and hose ought to show it- self courageous to petticoat.

“I wish I was home,” she said miserably. She tried so hard to be brave, to be fierce as a wolverine and all, but sometimes she felt like she was just a little girl after all. (ACOK)

in the end of as you like it rosalind sheds her disguise and returns to her true self. something arya will also do. then several couples all come together where they wed before nearly all of them return to court to live happily ever after. asoiaf’s ending probably won’t be so neat. theres death and destruction to contend with. but despite their differences there’s definitely a lot of similarities between these two stories. and in the end i think arya and gendry will find a place where they can be together too.

reblog.comment:

Most truly limned and living in your face, Be truly welcome hither. I am the duke
That loved your father. 

when duke senior meets orlando he quickly realizes he is his father’s son. ned had the same reaction to gendry:

That the armorer’s sullen apprentice was the king’s son, Ned had no doubt. The Baratheon look was stamped on his face, in his jaw, his eyes, that black hair. […] Gendry had to be Robert’s. (AGOT)

orlando and gendry have notable strength and are stubborn too. arya/gendry and orlando/rosalind must flee from court/the city or lose their lives and its in the forest where their relationships grow. in the forest, in disguise, they are able to form a bond that is seldom seen between men and women within the confines of court: friendship. they are equals in this environment. theres no rules so its a place of freedom and discovery. that goes doubly so for arya and gendry since unlike orlando he is of a much lower birth than arya

Sir you have wrestled well, and overthrown
more than your enemies.

both pairs also have significant wrestling scenes that are very symbolic. rosalind and orlando first meet after he successfully wrestles an opponent and both compare their instant feelings for each other to being “overthrown” the act of falling in love is compared to a wrestling match

Arya shoved him back against the anvil and made to run, but Gendry caught her arm. She stuck a foot between his legs and tripped him, but he yanked her down with him, and they rolled across the floor of the smithy. 

arya and gendry take it one step further by actually wrestling with each other. which would be considered highly inappropriate. arya is a princess and gendry is a blacksmith. but they don’t care. this scene is all romantic subtext. arya and gendry are just children now - this is playful - but the implications is that when they’re grown they’ll be wrestling in a less innocent way. its directly followed by a love song about a man and a woman who want to be together. he wants to lay her down in a featherbed but shes content to roll around in the grass. 

It was a lover and his lass,
That o’er the green cornfield did pass

But you can be my forest love,
and me your forest lass. (ASOS)

as you like it has more songs than any other shakespeare play (or so i read) asoiaf also features many songs. arya and gendry have their own love theme that revolves around the same major theme in this play which is the contrast between the conventions of society and the freedom nature provides. 

All the world’s a stage,
And all the men and women merely players;
They have their exits and their entrances,
And one man in his time plays many parts 

this is probably the plays most famous passage. i find it extremely applicable to arya who assumes numerous personas/aliases throughout her story - even becoming an actress in a very shakespearen like play. the theater is a hugely important element in her mercy chapter. the rest of this speech describes how lives are broken in “seven ages” from infant to lover to solider ect. which reminded me of the faith of the seven in asoiaf that breaks a single entity into several aspects that represent an individual’s layered humanity. 

I could find in my heart to disgrace my man’s apparel and to cry like a woman; but I must comfort
the weaker vessel, as doublet and hose ought to show it- self courageous to petticoat.

“I wish I was home,” she said miserably. She tried so hard to be brave, to be fierce as a wolverine and all, but sometimes she felt like she was just a little girl after all. (ACOK)

in the end of as you like it rosalind sheds her disguise and returns to her true self. something arya will also do. then several couples all come together where they wed before nearly all of them return to court to live happily ever after. asoiaf’s ending probably won’t be so neat. theres death and destruction to contend with. but despite their differences there’s definitely a lot of similarities between these two stories. and in the end i think arya and gendry will find a place where they can be together too.
trail.content:
there’s many similarities between asoiaf and shakespeare. as you like it is no exception. both contain themes of nature vs society (specifically “court”) and heavily feature songs. but its with three characters in particular - arya, ned and gendry - that i see the most similarities

Here shall he see no enemy
But winter and rough weather. 

duke senior is like ned stark if he had gotten lucky. the former is banished to the woods after a political coup which he’s actually pretty happy about because court is full of “peril” and “envy”. ned reflects that same attitude:

Eddard Stark wanted nothing so much as to return to Winterfell, to the clean simplicity of the north, where the enemies were winter and the wildlings beyond the Wall. (AGOT)

i find that to be a very compelling parallel. those quotes are exactly the same. they hate the court of liars and crave the wild. its dangerous, cold and brutal in its own way but honest. the north in asoiaf is considered one great wilderness since it does not have a traditional court. but while duke senior is eventually reinstated ned stark is executed. both their daughters are caught in the middle of this.

I do remember in this shepherd boy
Some lively touches of my daughter’s favor.

arya is forced to flee to the wilds disguised as a boy called arry (like rosalind who assumes the alias ganymede) as a result of her father’s involvement in these political instabilities. arya and rosalind are both clever, bold, loyal and resourceful. but arya’s relationship with gender is far more complicated than rosalind who does not “have a doublet and hose in [her] disposition” the play really reinforces gender roles in the end where as asoiaf is far more critical and allows for more complexity. but they do have another huge parallel and that is they form close bonds to the sons of the father’s friends

ARYA: Maybe King Robert had drunk a lot, but he’d been her father’s friend. 

ROSALIND: The duke my father loved his father dearly.

and its pretty obvious in both cases who their fathers are

If that you were the good Sir Rowland’s son, As you have whispered faithfully you were,
And as mine eye doth his effigies witness
Most truly limned and living in your face, Be truly welcome hither. I am the duke
That loved your father. 

when duke senior meets orlando he quickly realizes he is his father’s son. ned had the same reaction to gendry:

That the armorer’s sullen apprentice was the king’s son, Ned had no doubt. The Baratheon look was stamped on his face, in his jaw, his eyes, that black hair. […] Gendry had to be Robert’s. (AGOT)

orlando and gendry have notable strength and are stubborn too. arya/gendry and orlando/rosalind must flee from court/the city or lose their lives and its in the forest where their relationships grow. in the forest, in disguise, they are able to form a bond that is seldom seen between men and women within the confines of court: friendship. they are equals in this environment. theres no rules so its a place of freedom and discovery. that goes doubly so for arya and gendry since unlike orlando he is of a much lower birth than arya

Sir you have wrestled well, and overthrown
more than your enemies.

both pairs also have significant wrestling scenes that are very symbolic. rosalind and orlando first meet after he successfully wrestles an opponent and both compare their instant feelings for each other to being “overthrown” the act of falling in love is compared to a wrestling match

Arya shoved him back against the anvil and made to run, but Gendry caught her arm. She stuck a foot between his legs and tripped him, but he yanked her down with him, and they rolled across the floor of the smithy. 

arya and gendry take it one step further by actually wrestling with each other. which would be considered highly inappropriate. arya is a princess and gendry is a blacksmith. but they don’t care. this scene is all romantic subtext. arya and gendry are just children now - this is playful - but the implications is that when they’re grown they’ll be wrestling in a less innocent way. its directly followed by a love song about a man and a woman who want to be together. he wants to lay her down in a featherbed but shes content to roll around in the grass. 

It was a lover and his lass,
That o’er the green cornfield did pass

But you can be my forest love,
and me your forest lass. (ASOS)

as you like it has more songs than any other shakespeare play (or so i read) asoiaf also features many songs. arya and gendry have their own love theme that revolves around the same major theme in this play which is the contrast between the conventions of society and the freedom nature provides. 

All the world’s a stage,
And all the men and women merely players;
They have their exits and their entrances,
And one man in his time plays many parts 

this is probably the plays most famous passage. i find it extremely applicable to arya who assumes numerous personas/aliases throughout her story - even becoming an actress in a very shakespearen like play. the theater is a hugely important element in her mercy chapter. the rest of this speech describes how lives are broken in “seven ages” from infant to lover to solider ect. which reminded me of the faith of the seven in asoiaf that breaks a single entity into several aspects that represent an individual’s layered humanity. 

I could find in my heart to disgrace my man’s apparel and to cry like a woman; but I must comfort
the weaker vessel, as doublet and hose ought to show it- self courageous to petticoat.

“I wish I was home,” she said miserably. She tried so hard to be brave, to be fierce as a wolverine and all, but sometimes she felt like she was just a little girl after all. (ACOK)

in the end of as you like it rosalind sheds her disguise and returns to her true self. something arya will also do. then several couples all come together where they wed before nearly all of them return to court to live happily ever after. asoiaf’s ending probably won’t be so neat. theres death and destruction to contend with. but despite their differences there’s definitely a lot of similarities between these two stories. and in the end i think arya and gendry will find a place where they can be together too.

summary: So Arya is a gonna be a major player in the Great War against the Night King and it would be nice if some certain stans would...
body:
So Arya is a gonna be a major player in the Great War against the Night King and it would be nice if some certain stans would stop treating her like the Mike Wazowski of the Stark family.

She deserves more than that.

summary: I love any new GoT content, and I was super stoked to see the teaser, and finally get a release date... but it worries the crap...
body:
I love any new GoT content, and I was super stoked to see the teaser, and finally get a release date… but it worries the crap out of me that Jon’s statue looks like an old man, but Arya and Sansa’s still look like young women. If my Stark girls die I’m going to lose it! Like, I don’t want Jon dead, I like him a lot, but if I had to choose between him and the girls??? Boy bye!!! 

Gaaawww… I’m so nervous/excited!!

summary: Okay... I’m seeing a lot of discourse on the fact that Sansa doesn’t have a weapon in the teaser (even though her greatest...
body:
Okay… I’m seeing a lot of discourse on the fact that Sansa doesn’t have a weapon in the teaser (even though her greatest weapon is that big ass, beautiful brain of hers) and I agree 100% with everyone saying she doesn’t need to be a warrior to be important to the narrative. 

BUT I do now want a scene where there’s is a scuffle going on in the castle, Jon, Arya, Brienne, etc… are all fighting, Sam and Gilly are trying to usher Bran and Sansa from the room, but Sansa picks up a fallen sword to try and defend herself. Except she just stands there holding it, looking at it all confused, and shouts “what do I do with this” and Jon and Arya, while still fighting, both scream back: 

STICK THEM WITH THE POINTY END!!!

summary: This Game of Thrones teaser just showed how vulnerable people are if they only rely in politics but don't know how to fight....
body:
This Game of Thrones teaser just showed how vulnerable people are if they only rely in politics but don’t know how to fight. They will always need someone to protect them.

That’s why Arya is my favorite character alongside Jon. Unfortunately, I think she will die (I’ll be so mad if it happens) but this is the sort of things you get when you are a fighter.

Ps - Jon and Arya were not there with their swords to protect Sansa. It just happens that they have to protect their own lives and someone’s else because this person can’t fight.

summary:
Okay yeah, the statues are horrifying- but can we talk about 
how ABSOLUTELY BADASS IT IS that my girl is immoralized WITH HER...
body:
Okay yeah, the statues are horrifying- but can we talk about

how ABSOLUTELY BADASS IT IS that my girl is immoralized WITH HER SWORD DRAW THE ABSOLUTE QUEEN!!!! Even Jon has his sheathed- but even in death this goddess is ready to fuckin GO!!!
